refentry.refsect1:
Description
A SwfdecPlayer is the main object used for playing back Flash files through Swfdec.
A player interacts with the outside world in a multitude of ways. The most important ones are described below.
Input is handled via the SwfdecLoader class. A
SwfdecLoader is set on a new player using swfdec_player_set_loader().
When the loader has provided enough data, you can start playing the file. This is done in steps by calling swfdec_player_advance() - preferrably as often as swfdec_player_get_next_event() indicates. Or you can provide user input to the player by calling for example swfdec_player_handle_mouse().
You can use swfdec_player_render() to draw the current state of the player. After that, connect to the SwfdecPlayer:invalidate signal to be notified of changes.
Audio output is handled via the SwfdecAudio class. One
SwfdecAudio object is created for every output using the SwfdecPlayer::audio-added signal.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new player. This function is supposed to be used for testing. Because of this, the created player will behave as predictable as possible. For example, it will generate the same random number sequence every time. The function calls swfdec_init() for you if it wasn't called before.

entry.para: NULL or a SwfdecAsDebugger to use for debugging this player.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The new player

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_is_initialized ()
refsect2.para: Determines if the player is initalized yet. An initialized player is able to provide basic values like width, height or rate. A player may not be initialized if the loader it was started with does not reference a Flash resources or it did not provide enough data yet. If a player is initialized, it will never be uninitialized again.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the basic values are known.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_url ()
refsect2.para: Gets the URL of the resource that is currently played back. If no URL has been set on the player yet, NULL is returned.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the SwfdecURL currently played back or NULL

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_set_url ()
refsect2.para: Sets the url for the main data. This function may only be called once.

entry.para: the url for the initial reference in this player

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_base_url ()
refsect2.para: Gets the base URL that this player uses when resolving a relative URL. It is automatically set to the parent directory of the currently played back resource, but can be changed using swfdec_player_set_base_url(). When no resource has been set on the player yet, NULL is returned.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the base SwfdecURL for resolving relative links or NULL

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_set_base_url ()
refsect2.para: Sets the URL that will be used for resolving realtive links inside the player .

entry.para: a SwfdecURL or NULL to reset to defaults

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_variables ()
refsect2.para: Gets the initial variables for this player. See swfdec_player_set_variables() for details about variables.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a string represetation of the current variables or NULL if none are set on the player .

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_set_variables ()
refsect2.para: Sets the loader for the main data. This function may only be called if swfdec_player_set_url() has not been called yet. If the variables are set and validate, they will be set as properties on the root movie.

entry.para: a string that is checked to be in 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded' syntax describing the arguments to set on the new player or NULL for none.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_rate ()
refsect2.para: Queries the framerate of this movie. This number specifies the number of frames that are supposed to pass per second. It is a multiple of 1/256.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The framerate of this movie or 0 if it isn't known yet or the movie doesn't have a framerate.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_default_size ()
refsect2.para:
If the default size of the movie is initialized, fills in width and height
with the size. Otherwise width and height are set to 0.

entry.para: integer to store the width in or NULL
integer to store the height in or NULL

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_size ()
refsect2.para: Gets the currently set image size. If the default width or height should be used, the width or height respectively is set to -1.

entry.para: integer to store the width in or NULL
integer to store the height in or NULL

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_set_size ()
refsect2.programlisting: void swfdec_player_set_size (SwfdecPlayer *player, int width, int height);
refsect2.para: Sets the image size to the given values. The image size is what the area that the player will render and advocate with scripts.

entry.para: desired width of the movie or -1 for default
desired height of the movie or -1 for default

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_next_event ()
refsect2.para: Queries how long to the next event. This is the next time when you should call swfdec_player_advance() to forward to.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: number of milliseconds until next event or -1 if no outstanding event

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_background_color ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current suggested background color. The color will be an ARGB-color, with the MSB being the alpha value. Note that Swfdec will not render the background color itself, so if you want the background to not be translucent it is your job to clear the background using this color.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the background color as an ARGB value

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_scale_mode ()
refsect2.para: Gets the currrent mode used for scaling the movie. See SwfdecScaleMode for the different modes.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the current scale mode

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_set_scale_mode ()
refsect2.para: Sets the currrent mode used for scaling the movie. See SwfdecScaleMode for the different modes.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_alignment ()
refsect2.para: Gets the alignment of the player. The alignment describes what point is used as the anchor for drawing the contents. See SwfdecAlignment for possible values.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the current alignment

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_set_alignment ()
refsect2.para: Sets the alignment to align . For details about alignment, see swfdec_player_get_alignment() and SwfdecAlignment.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_scripting ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current scripting implementation in use. If no implementation is in use (the default), NULL is returned.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the current scripting implementation used or NULL if none

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_set_scripting ()
refsect2.para: Sets the implementation to use for external scripting in the given player . Note that this is different from the internal script engine. See the SwfdecPlayerScripting paragraph for details about external scripting.

entry.para: the scripting implementation to use or NULL to disable scripting

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_allow_fullscreen ()
refsect2.para: Checks if the player is allowed to go fullscreen. See swfdec_player_set_allow_fullscreen() for details.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the player is allowed to go fullscreen

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_set_allow_fullscreen ()
refsect2.para: Sets if the player is allowed to go fullscreen. If a player is allowed to go fullscreen, it may set the SwfdecPlayer::fullscreen property to TRUE. Players are not allowed to go fullscreen by default. Usually applications only want to allow going fullscreen in response to mouse or keyboard events.

entry.para: if the player should be allowed to go fullscreen

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_fullscreen ()
refsect2.para: CHecks if the player is in fullscreen mode currently. If the player is in fullscreen mode, it assumes it occupies the whole screen. A player will only ever go into fullscreen, if you have allowed it by calling swfdec_player_set_allow_fullscreen().

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the player is in fullscreen mode currently

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_renderer ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current renderer in use. See swfdec_player_set_renderer() for details.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the current SwfdecRenderer in use.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_set_renderer ()
refsect2.para: Sets the renderer to be used by the player . Setting the correct renderer is mostly relevant for TextField flash objects with native fonts, as the renderer provides those. It can also be very relevant for performance reasons. See the SwfdecRenderer documentation for details.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_render ()
refsect2.para: Renders the given area of the current frame to cr . This function just calls swfdec_player_render_with_renderer() using the player 's renderer.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_render_with_renderer ()
refsect2.para: Renders the given area of the current frame to cr . If you only want to redraw parts of the player, like when responding to a SwfdecPlayer:invalidate signal, set a clip on cr using cairo_clip():
Only redrawing parts of the player improves performance considerably.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_advance ()
refsect2.para: Advances player by msecs or at most one event, whatever happens first in the player's timeline. You should make sure to call this function as often as swfdec_player_get_next_event() indicates or your player will not appear smooth.

entry.para: number of milliseconds to advance at maximum

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: actual number of milliseconds advanced.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_mouse_move ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean swfdec_player_mouse_move (SwfdecPlayer *player, double x, double y);
refsect2.para: Updates the current mouse position. If the mouse has left the area of player , you should pass values outside the movie size for x and y . You will probably want to call swfdec_player_advance() before to update the player to the correct time when calling this function.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the mouse event was handled. FALSE if the event should be propagated further. A mouse event may not be handled if the user clicked on a translucent area.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_mouse_press ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean swfdec_player_mouse_press (SwfdecPlayer *player, double x, double y, guint button);
refsect2.para: Tells the player that the mouse button button was pressed at the given coordinate.

entry.para: number of the button that was pressed. Swfdec supports up to 32 buttons.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the mouse event was handled. FALSE if the event should be propagated further. A mouse event may not be handled if the user clicked on a translucent area.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_mouse_release ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean swfdec_player_mouse_release (SwfdecPlayer *player, double x, double y, guint button);
refsect2.para: Tells the player that the mouse button button was released at the given coordinate.

entry.para: number of the button that was released. Swfdec supports up to 32 buttons.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the mouse event was handled. FALSE if the event should be propagated further. A mouse event may not be handled if the user clicked on a translucent area.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_key_press ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean swfdec_player_key_press (SwfdecPlayer *player, guint keycode, guint character);
refsect2.para: Call this function to make the player react to a key press. A list of defined key codes is defined by SwfdecKey. You will likely need to translate from your keyboard API to the Flash key codes.

entry.para: the key that was pressed, must be smaller than 256.
UCS4 of the character that was inserted or 0 if none

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the key press was handled by the player , FALSE if it should be propagated further

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_key_release ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean swfdec_player_key_release (SwfdecPlayer *player, guint keycode, guint character);
refsect2.para: Call this function to make the player react to a key being released. See swfdec_player_key_press() for details.

entry.para: UCS4 of the character that was inserted or 0 if none

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the key press was handled by the player , FALSE if it should be propagated further

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_focus ()
refsect2.para: Checks if the player has keyboard focus. See swfdec_player_set_focus() for details.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the player has keyboard focus.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_set_focus ()
refsect2.para: Tells the player whether keyboard focus is inside it. The player will use this information to draw focus indicators around objects. Note that this update will not happen immediately, but only the next time you call swfdec_player_advance(). The player is focussed by default. So if you integrate it into a widget system such, you likely want to unset this upon creation of the player.

note.para: The player must be focussed to receive keyboard events.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_selection ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the currently selected text of the player. If no text is currently selected, NULL is returned.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the currently selected text or NULL

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_audio ()
refsect2.para: Returns a list of all currently active audio streams in player .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A GList of SwfdecAudio. You must not modify or free this list.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_get_maximum_runtime ()
refsect2.para: Queries the given player for how long scripts may run. see swfdec_player_set_maximum_runtime() for a longer discussion of this value.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the maximum time in milliseconds that scripts are allowed to run or 0 for infinite.

refsect2.title: swfdec_player_set_maximum_runtime ()
refsect2.para: Sets the time that the player may use to let internal scripts run. If the Flash file that is currently played back does not manage to complete its scripts in the given time, it is aborted. You cannot continue the scripts at a later point in time. However, your application may become unresponsive and your users annoyed if they cannot interact with it for too long. To give a reference point, the Adobe Flash player usually sets this value to 10 seconds. Note that this time determines the maximum time calling swfdec_player_advance() may take, even if it is called with a large value. Also note that this setting is ignored when running inside a debugger.

entry.para: time in milliseconds that scripts are allowed to run or 0 for infinite

refsect2.title: struct SwfdecPlayer
refsect2.para: This is the base object used for playing Flash files.

refsect2.title: The alignment property
refsect2.para: point of the screen to align the output to.

refsect2.title: The allow-fullscreen property
refsect2.para: if the player is allowed to change into fullscreen mode.

refsect2.title: The background-color property
refsect2.para: ARGB color used to draw the background.

refsect2.title: The base-url property
refsect2.para: base URL for creating new resource or NULL if not set yet.

refsect2.title: The focus property
refsect2.para: TRUE if the player has keyboard focus.

refsect2.title: The fullscreen property
refsect2.para: if the player is in fullscreen mode.

refsect2.title: The initialized property
refsect2.para: TRUE when the player has initialized its basic values.

refsect2.title: The loader-type property
refsect2.para: type to use for creating loaders.

refsect2.title: The max-runtime property
refsect2.para: maximum time in msecs scripts may run in the player before aborting.

refsect2.title: The mouse-cursor property
refsect2.para: how the mouse pointer should be presented.

refsect2.title: The next-event property
refsect2.para: how many milliseconds until the next event or -1 when no event pending.

refsect2.title: The renderer property
refsect2.para: the renderer used by this player.

refsect2.title: The scale-mode property
refsect2.para: method used to scale the movie.

refsect2.title: The socket-type property
refsect2.para: type to use for creating sockets.

refsect2.title: The start-time property
refsect2.para: time to use as the beginning time for this player.

refsect2.title: The url property
refsect2.para: URL of resource currently played back or NULL if not set.

refsect2.title: The variables property
refsect2.para: variables to use when setting the URL.

refsect1.title: Signal Details

refsect2.title: The advance signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (SwfdecPlayer *player, gulong msecs, guint audio_samples, gpointer user_data)

entry.para: the amount of milliseconds the player will advance
number of frames the audio is advanced (in 44100Hz steps)

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The audio-added signal
refsect2.para: Emitted whenever a new audio stream was added to player .

entry.para: the audio stream that was added

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The audio-removed signal
refsect2.para:
Emitted whenever an audio stream was removed from player . The stream will
have been added with the SwfdecPlayer::audio-added signal previously.

entry.para: the audio stream that was removed

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect1.refsect2:
The fscommand signal SwfdecPlayer::fscommand void user_function (SwfdecPlayer *player, gchar *command, gchar *parameter, gpointer user_data) This signal is emited whenever a Flash script command (also known as
fscommand) is encountered. This method is ued by the Flash file to communicate with the hosting environment. In web browsers it is used to
call Javascript functions. Standalone Flash players understand a limited
set of functions. They vary from player to player, but the most common are
listed here:
"quit": quits the player.
"fullscreen": A boolean setting (parameter is "true" or
"false") that sets the player into fullscreen mode.
"allowscale": A boolean setting that tells the player to not scale the Flash application.
"showmenu": A boolean setting that tells the Flash player to not show its own entries in the right-click menu.
"exec": Run an external executable. The parameter
specifies the path.
"trapallkeys": A boolean setting that tells the Flash
player to pass all key events to the Flash application instead of using it for keyboard shortcuts or similar.
Parameters
player
the SwfdecPlayer affected
command
the command to execute. This is a lower case string.
parameter
parameter to pass to the command. The parameter depends on the function.
user_data user data set when the signal handler was connected.
Flags: Run Last

refsect2.title: The handle-key signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (SwfdecPlayer *player, guint key, guint pressed, gboolean Returns, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para:
This signal is emitted whenever player should respond to a key event. If any of the handlers returns TRUE, swfdec_player_key_press() or
swfdec_player_key_release() will return TRUE. Note that unlike many event
handlers in gtk, returning TRUE will not stop further event handlers from
being invoked. Use g_signal_stop_emission() in that case.

entry.para: SwfdecKey that was pressed or released
TRUE if the key was pressed or FALSE if it was released

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if this handler handles the event.

refsect2.title: The handle-mouse signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (SwfdecPlayer *player, gdouble x, gdouble y, gint button, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para:
This signal is emitted whenever player should respond to a mouse event. If any of the handlers returns TRUE, swfdec_player_handle_mouse() will return
TRUE. Note that unlike many event handlers in gtk, returning TRUE will not
stop further event handlers from being invoked. Use g_signal_stop_emission() in that case.

entry.para: new x coordinate of the mouse
new y coordinate of the mouse
0 for a mouse move, a positive number if a button was pressed, a negative number if a button was released

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if this handler handles the event.

refsect2.title: The invalidate signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (SwfdecPlayer *player, gpointer rectangles, guint n_rectangles, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para:
This signal is emitted whenever graphical elements inside the player have
changed. It provides two ways to look at the changes: By looking at the extents parameter, it provides a simple way to get a single rectangle that encloses all changes. By looking at the rectangles array, you can get finer control over changes which is very useful if your rendering system
provides a way to handle regions.

entry.para: a number of smaller rectangles for fine-grained control over changes

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The launch signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (SwfdecPlayer *player, gchar *url, gchar *target, SwfdecBuffer *data, guint header_count, GStrv header_names, GStrv header_values, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para:
Emitted whenever the player encounters an URL that should be loaded into
a target the Flash player does not recognize. In most cases this happens
when the user clicks a link in an embedded Flash movie that should open a new web page. The effect of calling any swfdec functions on the emitting player is undefined.

entry.para: target to load the URL into
optional data to pass on with the request. Can be NULL indicating no data should be passed.
number of custom HTTP headers to be sent
names of the custom HTTP headers. NULL terminated
values of the custom HTTP headers. NULL terminated

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The missing-plugins signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (SwfdecPlayer *player, GStrv details, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para:
Emitted whenever a plugin is detected that GStreamer cannot currently
handle because it is missing plugins to do so. You should use
gst_install_plugins_async() to install those plugins.

entry.para: the details strings for all missing plugins

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The query-size signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (SwfdecPlayer *player, gboolean fullscreen, gpointer width, gpointer height, gpointer user_data)
refsect2.para:
This signals is emitted whenever the player is (un)fullscreened. In this
case it requests the new size the Flash file will be displayed in
immediately. If you want to provide values, connect to this signal. The values don't have to be exact, you can still call swfdec_player_set_size() later on. However, it will look visually nicer if your values here are
correct. By default, the screen resolution values will be used for
fullscreen and the default size will be used otherwise.

entry.para: TRUE if the player queries the fullscreen size, FALSE for the default size
pointer to an integer that takes the width to use
pointer to an integer that takes the height to use

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if this handler properly sets width and height and no other handlers should be invoked.
